de.iss.mv2.client.messaging

Class MessageProcedure<E extends java.lang.Throwable,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.iss.mv2.client.messaging.MessageProcedure<E,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The type of the result.
    E - The type of exception that can occur during this procedure.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InboxUpdateProcedure, InitialProcedure, MailSendingProcedure, MessageFetchProcedure, MessageQueryProcedure, SwingMessageProcedure

    public abstract class MessageProcedure<E extends java.lang.Throwable,R>
extends java.lang.Object
    A procedure to execute and manage subsequent server calls.
    Author:
    Marcel Singer

      • runImmediate

        public R runImmediate()
               throws ProcedureException
        Runs this procedure immediately on the calling thread an returns the procedure result.

        Remarks: If the procedure is executed by this method only the ProcedureListener.procedureStateChanged(MessageProcedure, String, int) method might be called.

        Returns:
        The result of this procedure.
        Throws:
        ProcedureException - Is thrown if there is any exception during the execution of this procedure. See Throwable.getCause() to get more informations about the thrown exception.

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs this procedure.

      • addProcedureListener

        public void addProcedureListener(ProcedureListener<R> listener)
        Registers the given listener to be notified when the state of this procedure changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to add.

      • removeProcedureListener

        public void removeProcedureListener(ProcedureListener<R> listener)
        Removes the given listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove.

      • setEventThreadSynchronizer

        protected void setEventThreadSynchronizer(ThreadSynchronizer synchronizer)
        Sets the synchronizer that is used to invoke the event methods of the registered listeners.

        Remarks: Invoke this method during the construction or initialization of a new procedure. Changing the synchronizer during the execution of this procedure can cause unexpected behavior.

        Parameters:
        synchronizer - The synchronizer to set. If the given synchronizer is null it will be reset to its default.

      • setProcedureThreadSynchronizer

        protected void setProcedureThreadSynchronizer(ThreadSynchronizer synchronizer)
        Sets the synchronizer that is used to invoke the execution of this procedure.

        Remarks: Invoke this method during the construction or initialization of a new procedure. Changing the synchronizer during the execution of this procedure can cause unexpected behavior.

        Parameters:
        synchronizer - The synchronizer to set. If the given synchronizer is null it will be reset to its default.
